{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4707].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA, if there are any projects with public access, anonymous user can browse ticket by using the issue navigator without login to JIRA. However if a user is logged in as JIRA Service Desk customer then he/she will be redirected automatically to Customer Portal and will not be able to access issue navigator.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Service Desk customer to access issue navigator and add an option to define the default page for Service Desk customer after login.
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk customer to access issue navigator
[Feature Request] Make work logs available to customer panel (readonly)

h3. Summary
Bug in CSS no longer displays Time to Resolution in red when breached in JIRA 7. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install  JIRA 6.4 and JIRA 7 with JSD. 
# Setup a filter gadget with the Time to Resolution field.
# Set the filter to pull in breached tickets. 


h3. Expected Results
Both should show time to resolution in red.
h3. Actual Results
In 6.4 it works as expected. However in 7.2 it does not show the breached time in red. 
!Time.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Please revert the filter gadget field to flag the Time to Resolution field in red.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4700].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Since 3.3.0, notification emails are now combined together if multiple activities happen around the same time.
* For example, a new request created by a customer via email and an Agent respond to the customer immediately when the request appears in the queue. The customer will receive one email only with the request created message, Agent's comment and status change message in a conversation format.

h3. Suggestion
It should be configurable whether the notification should be sent in the conversation format or not, the emails shouldn't be combined

h3. Why is this important
# With the default format of email, users are prone to overlook the important message in the email.
# Customers are expected to receive an email to confirm on request created, and another email when the Agent replies to the request. With the combined email, customers might just ignore the first email as they will treat it as just a confirmation email.
fields.summary: As an admin, I do not want the customer notification emails to be combined or sent with conversation format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4699].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
After changing a Software type project to Service Desk type, the Request types will be automatically generated based on conditions below.
* If there are more than 2 existing components in the project, 2 of the components and 1 of the issue types will be copied as the Request Types.
* If there is only 1 existing component in the project, that particular component and 2 of the issue types will be copied as the Request Types.
* If there is no existing component in the project, 3 of the issue types will be copied as the Request Types.

h3. Suggestion
Allow admins to choose which component or issue type should be copied as a Request Type

h3. Why is it important
Randomly creating the Request Types from existing components and issue types requires additional workload to the admin. It should be flexible enough to let admin to decide which ones should be used.
fields.summary: Changing a Software type project to Service Desk type should allow admin to select Request Types from Components and Issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4698].
{panel}
{panel:title=Product update 5th November, 2021}
Hello everyone,

Thank you for your continued interest and comments. This feature is on our backlog. We have currently prioritised issues around the incoming email experience. The team has completed work around setting up incoming email (Google and Microsoft) and incoming logs, and is currently focused on ensuring that new requests and comments reach the right ticket and are displayed correctly for agents.

Once that piece of work is completed we will be able to provide an update on this request.

We appreciate your continued patience with this and other important requests.
Thanks,
Jira Service Management product team
{panel}
h3. Problem Description

Currently, there is no way to track every mail notification sent out by JIRA Service Desk to customers and it would be great to have such a feature.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an outgoing mail logs so that users can track if some emails are not sent out to certain customers.
fields.summary: Provide an outgoing email logs
Function everBreached() need to meet its case sensitivity to work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4696].
  {panel}

h5. +Issue Summary+

When a JIRA instance is in a *secured environment which does not allow outside access*, should an agent reply to a customer and the reply contains Attached files, JIRA would show the attachments as links.

As mentioned since JIRA is in a secured environment, this would prevent access to the files mostly.

h5. +Expected+

JIRA should attach the file directly to the email similar to how it works with incoming emails.

h5. +Actual+

JIRA Adds a link that references the attachment to the reply.
fields.summary: Allow Outgoing Mail Add Attachment Rather than Reference Link.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4695].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
There is a panel in every request showing a list of users whom the request has been shared with, even if the request is not shared with anyone else except the reporter him/herself.
However, it's not configurable to hide the list of user(s).

h3. Suggestion
* Allow to show/hide the list of user(s)

h3. Why is this important
# The list is shown even when the request is not shared with anyone, the information does not need to be there.
# In some use cases, we do not want any customer to see the user list as there might be incidents where the request is shared with customers from different organizations or etc and this will impact the business.
# It's not necessary for the customers to know whom are they sharing the request with.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to be able to hide the 'People involved' or 'Shared with' panel from customer requests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4690].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:

At the moment for JIRA Service Desk 3.3, on the page, that is a message that a satisfaction feedback will be sent out when an issue is resolved. But, there is no information about the prerequisite that it comes out with "Request Resolved" notification and only Service Desk generated notifications.

Then, for JIRA Service Desk prior to 3.3, the documentation did not mention that the feature only works for JIRA Service Desk generated notifications. Hence, if the "JSD Global Notification" option is disabled in which the option is not available anymore on version 3.3, the Satisfaction Feedback would not be included even though it is enabled.
 - [Collecting Customer Notification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER031/Collecting+customer+satisfaction+%28CSAT%29+feedback]

h3. Suggested Solution:

For the settings in version 3.3, a message which mentions that the "Request Resolved" notification is needed will be great. While the documentation on the previous version is updated that mentions it only works for JIRA Service Desk generated notifications.
h3. Why is it needed:

To prevent any misunderstanding on how the Satisfaction Feedback expected to work.e

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4686].
  {panel}

h5. +Usage Summary+

When a JIRA Admin wants to trigger the Satisfaction survey to be sent out on specific issue types, there is no way to customize and set this up as JIRA allows you to only enable or disable it.

h5. +Usage Scenario+

If a company has multiple request types that require very different usage scenarios(*bug report* vs *request time off*) and different target customers(bug report is meant for customers mainly while request time off is meant for their employees).

Should both of these happen to be in the same service desk project, once the satisfaction survey is enabled, there is no way for them to specify when a survey should be sent based on request type.

h5. +Feature Request+

Improve the functionality of the satisfaction survey to allow users to specify which request types should trigger it.

h5. +Workaround+

In the mean time, we would suggest having different projects for request types you want surveys to be sent for when the issue is closed and those that you do not want to have a notification sent for.
fields.summary: Allow Customization of Service Desk survey trigger

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4685].
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Updated as of 4 March 2021}
Thanks to Marc for raising this issue and for everyone who has provided input. We aren't considering this at this point in time as we currently support linking tickets as the recommended solution.

!image-2021-03-04-16-18-19-890.png|thumbnail!

We recommend you use this functionality in the short- to medium-term but will review whether or not we want to provide an enhanced solution during our next prioritisation sessions.

Best regards,

Jehan Gonsalkorale

Product manager, Jira Service Management
{panel}


*Problem:* We often get multiple requests for the same thing. Sometimes it is because of human error and other times because of a customer replying to a notification via a different email address. 

We MUST have the ability to be able to merge issues. This is standard in all the leading service and support desk systems. Our customers (internal) all log in via single sign on. However half the users use an alias as their primary email and this means we get duplicate issues for 50% of requests as soon as the customer replies to a question. 

Currently we have to delete the new "duplicate" as the SLA would be inaccurate and the user would get very confused.
fields.summary: Merge issue feature needed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4684].
  {panel}

Allow an attached or imported csv file to be added as a comment which is automatically formatted as a table.

Reason for Requirement:
 * Displaying search results/outputs from external systems
 * When dealing with logs in particular, it's important to have the ability to highlight key rows
 * Saving time from opening/downloading attached files
 * Allowing key attached data to be searchable

Currently I partially solve this problem by pushing csv files through a local script. Unfortunately this isn't user friendly and takes more time than necessary.

There are a number of discussions and tools that also partially solve this problem, so there is definitely demand for a native feature like this:
 * [http://excel2jira.bluurgh.com/]
 * [http://www.exceltojira.com/]
 * [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/111762/convert-a-spreadsheet-into-a-table]
 * [https://github.com/bennadel/JIRA-CSV-Formatter]

Note: I'm unsure whether this fits better under JIRA Software or JIRA Service Desk. Feel free to move it if required.
fields.summary: Create a Table From a CSV or Excel attachment

We've had an issue with calls in regards to issues that customers are participants of but have not yet commented in the issue which makes finding the issue they called in regards to extremely hard.

 

This could easily be solved by creating a new column in the Customers tab within Service Desk titled "Participant of" which lists and gives a link to all issues the user is a participant of.

Another column here would greatly simplify searching for users that are participating in issues but do not have any "open"

h3. Problem Definition

Hi atlassian,

Every message the sent from Jira starts with ‘Hi’, which is not always the formall way to contact with clients.

Therefore I would like to suggest the following Honorifics:

+English:+

Dear Mr.  $customer-surname, (if gender = male)

Dear Mrs. $customer-surname, (if gender = female)

Dear Sir or Madam, (if gender unknown)

and closing the email with:

Best Regards,

$agent-given-name $agent-surname

+German:+

Sehr geehrter Herr $customer-surname, (if gender = male)

Sehr geehrte Frau $customer-surname, (if gender = female)

Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, (if gender unknown)

and closing the email with:

Mit freundlichen Grüßen,

$agent-given-name $agent-surname

 

 

 

 

 

Kind Regards,

Adi

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When there are multiple approvers added in a transition, users will not receive any notification until all approvers have approved the transition. It would be useful to have notifications to be sent out when each of them approves, so that the users would know exactly who has/has not approved without logging in to the customer portal or JSD.

h3. Suggestion

JSD should fire a system event, ie Issue Approved. So that JSD admin can customize who should receive the notification in the notification scheme.
fields.summary: A notification should be sent when each approver approves a transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4663].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When an email requests adds a comment and adds request participants to a request, then an SLA can be in an incorrect state (not running, not paused, not stopped). The propability for this to happen is when the email triggers an automation rule and that rule triggers an SLA change.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workflow for your project that has the states "Waiting for Support", "Waiting for Customer" and "Resolved"
 ## The initial state of the workflow should be "Waiting for Support"
 ## The end state of the Workflow should be "Resolved"
 ## A transition from "Waiting for Support" to "Waiting for Customer" has to exist
 # Create an SLA that

 ## Starts when the request enters status "Waiting for Customer"
 ## Pauses when the request is in status "Waiting for Support"
 ## Stops when the request enters status "Resolved"
 # Create an automation rule

 ## When comment is added to an issue
 ## Then transitions issue from "Waiting for support" to "Waiting for Customer
 # Create a new request that uses the above workflow
 # Send an email to the system that will
 ## Trigger a comment on the request
 ## Add participants to the request

h3. Expected Results
 # A comment is added to the issue
 # The request participants are added to the issue
 # The SLA is running

h3. Actual Results

In some cases the SLA is not running
h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: When an email message comments and adds request participants at the same time the value of an SLA can be in the wrong state

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4662].
  {panel}

A particular use case that has come up is the need to raise a service desk issue into an organization.

Example:
 * Agent identifies an issue and wishes to notify a customer (or organiztion)
 * Monitoring system raises an issue

Because an agent may be the one to raise the issue, they should stick as the reporter – but would also be the assignee. This is noted as a bad idea since it messes with satisfying SLAs – especially when the SLAs may include conditions such as "Comment: For customer".

Of course, there's also the point that when raising an issue into an organization, which of the members of this organization should be assigned or receiving notifications about this issue?

I don't think this is a rare or even obscure use case so maybe it could become a priority?

A workaround that we're working with is creating an internal user part of the organization only used by the agents with which we can raise issues. This is a pretty dirty workaround though...

Thanks!
fields.summary: Support for agent to raise an issue into a client organization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

+Issue Summary+

When an issue is created, can the organization the user belong to be added automatically to the Organization field?

+Suggestion+

Add the ability to create an Automation Rule that allows updating issue field Organization if the user is a member of the organization.

+Workaround+

Reporter can choose an organization to share during the request creation on the Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4660].
  {panel}

h4. Problem Definition
Newly created portal users through User Provisioning Sync (Google, AD, etc) do not come with any organization as default. You can only choose an organization if inserting the customer directly to a project. Being able to automatically assign them to a default organization would resolve this.


h4. Suggested Solution
It would be good to automate user's creation by adding a default organization. So you can choose which SD Projects this user will be able to access by adding this organization to those projects.

h4. Workaround

# *Use REST APIs to add the users to an Org*
We do have some endpoints that can be use to create a script to automate that process. Check the details below:
## [Get the users' accountId|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-users-search-get]:
 The last API requires you to have the _accountId_ of the users you want to add to the Org. To get that information from all your users you can use the following API
 Request type: _GET_
 Endpoint: *_/rest/api/3/users/search_*
 Payload:+_Not needed_+
## [Get an Organization Id|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-group-Organization]:
 You also need to get the _OrganizationId_ to specify to which Org you want to add the users to. For that use the following call
 Request type: *_GET_*
 Endpoint: *_/rest/servicedeskapi/organization_*
 Payload:+_Not needed_+
## [Add users to an Org|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-organization-organizationId-user-post]:
 Request type: _POST_
 Endpoint: _*/rest/servicedeskapi/organization/ \{organizationId}*_*/user*
Payload:
{code:java}
data '{
  "accountIds": [
    "qm:a713c8ea-1075-4e30-9d96-891a7d181739:5ad6d3581db05e2a66fa80b",
    "qm:a713c8ea-1075-4e30-9d96-891a7d181739:5ad6d3a01db05e2a66fa80bd"
  ]
}'
{code}
+*Note*+: that these APIs are subject to change so please always review the required field and API versions at: 
- [Jira Service Desk APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/]
- [Jira Cloud APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/]
fields.summary: Be able to choose a default Organization for newly created users via user provisioning

h3. Problem Description

At this moment, users can only search for statuses but *not* the status name to show to the customer. As a user, I'd like to export a report and show it to the customer with the "external status" (status that is shown to the customer)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4657].
  {panel}

h5. +Issue Summary+

Following the release of JIRA 3.3, when a user sets their preferred language to a different language than the default, most items appear in the language set by the customer.

The problem however is that Request types and descriptions are not changed and appear in the language they were created in.

For example: We have a Request type: *Request Account* with the Description *Request to have an Account Created to access the System*, if the user who is a German speaker changes the language from English to Deustch, the request types and their descriptions would still be in the default set by the portal admin.

h5. +Steps to Reproduce+

# Create a new Request type in a Service Desk project that is in English Language.
# Go to customer portal.
# Set the language preference at the customer portal to French or any non English language.
# Attempt to create an issue.

h5. +Expected Behavior+

JIRA would show the names of request types and their description in the language the user selected.

h5. +Actual Behavior+

JIRA would show the request type and it's description in the language configured from the JIRA UI of the project by the project Admin.
fields.summary: Improvement to JIRA Service Desk Translation.

h3. Summary
There a number of default reports where users are able to select a time period for the report (eg. 48h, 7days, 1month, etc). Once the period is selected, the issues will be displayed but will be separated depending on the period. For example, if the period is 7 days, the issues will be shown separated per day. However, there isn't a *Total* figure which users can easily click to see results for *all* issues in that period

h3. Suggestion
Add another row to display total issues for that period. It should also be a link which will allow users to navigate to the Issue Navigator directly
!report.png|thumbnail!

h3. Problem Definition
Advanced Service desk managers would like to have a better control on how organizations are being operated

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4651].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
When using automation rules on JIRA SD, approvers are not able to be set to be notified when the time remaining SLA condition is set on the "When" field.

The following warning is displayed:
"Approvers doesn't work with the current "When" trigger. Remove the recipient or consider a new trigger"

This feature would be necessary to notify approvers before the SLA be breached in JIRA SD. They can receive transition notifications from events, although it does not let they receive a new notification before the SLA be breached.

h3. Solution
Add a feature to let approvers receive notifications before the SLA be breached.

h3. Workaround
Use a transition to notify approvers when the issue need their approval or use external plugins
fields.summary: Let approvers be notified of the SLA time remaining condition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4650].
  {panel}

The field used to store the SLA value only has numeric operators, but no "is empty" test. 

Step to reproduce :
 * Configure an SLA in a way some of the requests are not matched
 * Try to create a JQL expression specifically matching the missed issues.

Needed for :
 * Checking that the JSD admins / project admins are not missing any issues in the SLA configurations.
 * Checking the SLA configuration matches a specific set of issues

Related to : [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/46082572]

Affects Versions : 1.2.6.1, 3.2.7, 3.3.0

h4. Workaround
# Create a saved filter like "My SLA Not Empty" with JQL like:  project = MYPROJECT AND "My SLA" = breached() OR "My SLA" != breached()
# Reference the saved filter in a NOT query: project = MYPROJECT AND filter != "My SLA Not Empty"

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Find-issues-with-specific-SLA-field-beeing-empty/qaq-p/261489#U77355
fields.summary: Add an "is empty" operator on the JSD "SLA" field type.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for {*}JIRA Service Desk Cloud{*}. Using {*}JIRA Service Desk Server{*}? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4648].
{panel}
h3. Problem Solution:

At the moment, with the new feature of grouping user to an Organization. This includes the feature to set a request whether it is available for the Customer organization or a private request which is great. But, there is no option to set the default of the visibility or make it hidden.
h3. Suggested Solution:

To have the option to disable the Request Visibility when raising a request where it will set by default whether it will available for the organization that the customer in or private. If possible, it will affect JIRA issue creation as well for JIRA Service Desk project.
h3. Why is it important:

The use case scenario is to disable this option where the organization requests will be shared automatically among each other.
{quote}If a customer creates a new issue, they can choose to make the request private. I'd like to disable this.
When we manually create an issue and set the reporter to one of our customers, the organization remains unset. We can manually set an organization, but I want to make this process automatic depending on the originator. That is, if I set the originator of the issue to user X, and user X is part of organization Y, I want to add organization Y to the organization field to enable everyone that belongs to Y to view the issue.
{quote}
 
||*Update as of 26 Nov 2020*||
|Hi everyone,
I'm happy to share that we have implemented an option to disable sharing requests with an Organization by default. Admins can change the default Organization sharing behaviour by going to Settings > Products > Configuration (under Jira Service Management), under the "Organization management" section.
This provides a way to change the default visibility as requested, however we do not intend to add an option to hide it completely, so I'm closing off this suggestion.
Cheers,
The Jira Service Management team|
fields.summary: Raise Request Visibility to have an option to be disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4643].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Ability to create multiple unique forms under an individual issue/request type

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer can continue to create individual request types, but if they have a requirement to have 20-30 unique forms then customer is going to have 20-30 unique issue/request types which of course would become unmanageable over time.

h3. Why this is important
It would be incredibly useful to have the ability to create multiple unique forms under an individual issue/request type so that you can capture the right information at the first point of contact from the customer. The best example for this would be Service Requests as they can come in all different flavors.

Possible Service Requests that would need a unique form are as follows:

* New employee request form
* Employee leaving form
* Database access request form
* Hardware ordering form
* Software ordering form
* Basically anything that either needs to be approved or tracked.
 
h3. Workaround 
No
fields.summary: Ability to create multiple unique forms under an individual issue/request type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4638].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, there's no option to configure the default share preference of a ticket. When the reporter belongs to an Organisation, their request will be shared among the organisation unless they change it to "Private request" manually. This could lead to accidental oversharing if they forgot to set to "Private request".

Also, a notification will be sent to all users within the organisation if "share with Organisation" option is accidentally chosen.
 By default the sharing level of new requests is "Private", it should be possible to set a project-level default for this field to share the request with the user's assigned organisation.

In the event that a user is a member of more than one organisation, then the field should default to "Private" to avoid accidental oversharing.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow admin to set the default level as Issue Security Level.

h3. Why this is important
 * To avoid accidental oversharing of data
 * To avoid spam notification within the organisation
fields.summary: Allow administrators to set the default sharing level of new requests

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a new Service Desk is created, JIRA Service Desk doesn't check for existing sub-task types with the same name as the default issue types created by JSD.
This will cause JSD to map valid request types to sub-tasks, which is not supported and hence throw an error when creating new requests.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create sub-tasks with the same name as the JIRA Service Desk issue types (e.g. Incident / Problem / Service Request)
# Create a Service Desk project that uses those issue types.
# Navigate to the the *new project > Project Settings > Request Types*.
# Double-check that the request is mapped to a sub-task, as the screenshot below:
!incident.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Service Desk should not create an inconsistent configuration - It should either:
* Create a new issue type so that the mapping works properly.
* Prompt users that the issue type is already mapped to a sub-task and hence one of the issue types will have to be renamed.

h5. +Issue Summary+

When a user sends an email and adds a group email in the TO or CC fields, JIRA sends out an email to all users in the group email via the mailing list but should anyone of them click on the create link, they get associated with the email and other members would no longer be able to reply or have their replies considered as new tickets.

h3. Summary
Logged Service Desk customers can't comment in Public Confluence Knowledge bases despite having the required permissions to do so, since anonymous access to publish comments are allowed.

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SD project
# Create a knowledge linked with this SD
# Make this Knowledge base public and enable anonymous comments
# Login with a SD customer
# Go to this Knowledge base

h3. Expected Results
Just as anonymous customers, SD logged customers should be able to perform comments.

h3. Actual Results
SD Customers can't perform comments, not even anonymous ones.
 

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Logged Service Desk customers can't comment in Public Confluence Knowledge bases

h3. Problem Definition
Currently customers would be able to remove an organization from a request resulting other customers in the same organization to not receive notification and access to the request.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add configuration for administrators to disable customers from removing organization from request.
h3. Why this is important
When an organization is removed from a request by mistake, all other customers are denied access to the request and do not receive notification.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4616].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, using the Organisations in Jira Service Desk for customers, customers can share created issues within their organisation. 

The customer would want a solution for sharing issues of specific issue type with a group of customers.

For example, the organization "Employees" can open issue in "Computer" Request Type to ask about keyboard and mouse. But organization "Technical" can open issue in "Network" Request Type to ask about network problem. Customers from the organisation "Employees" can only see issues from the "Computer" Request type. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility for Request Type permission in Jira Service desk
 
h3. Workaround 
Create separate projects for issues with specific Request Type and add organisation for this specific project only
fields.summary: Add ability to share issues based on Request types

h3. Problem Definition
When attempting to invite a large of customers in Service Desk, inputting more than 40+ customers emails will make the "Send invite" button disappear from view and the user is unable to scroll down to click on the "Send invite" button.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Resizing the screen does not help as the invite customers dialog box scales along with the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a scrollbar to the UI so that the user can scroll down and click on the "Send invite" button.
 
h3. Workaround 
Press the "Enter" key after clicking on the field to invite the users instead.

h3. Problem Definition
The automation's When condition (Edit issue assignee) only allows selecting a specific user or automatic.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the _user who triggered the rule_ user to the selection
h3. Why this is important
To simplify the process of assigning the issue to the agent who replies/update customer
h3. Workaround 
Use a combination of workflow post function and automation. Using an add comment to transition automation will transition the issue when an agent comments on the ticket while using a post function to Assign to Current User would assign the issue to the agent.

I am considering integrating JIRA service desk with our site.I have read [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud/#authentication/|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/cloud/] and I see that I can use the API to create users, but it does not set their passwords or provide authentication. Ideally, I would like to:
 * create a user in service desk each time a user is created in our system AND have the password be the same
 * when a user clicks on the "help desk" button on our site, they should be directed to JIRA service desk AND logged in to JIRA service desk.

I also noticed that much of the JIRA service desk REST API is still experimental. I am wondering when this will change.

h3. Summary

h3. Problem Definition
When viewing the Customer Portal, users may search for key words that bring up a filtered result list of requests types that match the keyword typed in.

Customers can filter down request types and would help prevent them from creating request types in the wrong area

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Service Desk notifications for customer do not obey ordinary notification scheme, which is a good way to split notification sending and also is good to edit the e-mail content. However, you are only able to set up notification sending (to costumers) with the following options: Reporter or Customers Involved (request participants). This can limit some cases, like e.g: You have other 'User fields' for people like Stakeholders, who should receive some specific notifications. 



h3. Suggested Solution
Be able to add other entities for the 'To:' field in customer notifications, like Customer Field Value (as it has on notification schemes) or be able to add customers or customers within a custom field into notification scheme (which currently don't work as JIRA Notification schemes work only for internal users not customers)

h3. Summary
When removing the 'Project Role (Service Desk Team)' role from the 'Service Desk Agent' project permission, JIRA Service Desk indicates there is an issue with the Permission scheme. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk 3.2.6.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project or open an existing Service Desk project.
# Remove the 'Project Role (Service Desk Team)' project role from the 'Service Desk Agent' permission.
# Load the Service Desk project.

h3. Expected Results
Users should be able to access the Service Desk without issue.

h3. Actual Results
A modal popup is displayed indicating there is an issue with the Service Desk projects Permission Scheme and offers to resolve the issue.

h3. Notes
The following popup can be seen:
 !permission_error.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
The current workaround is to leave this group within the project role.

Example, after an issue has been assigned to an individual (example = "Chris"), and this Assignee adds a comment to issue, which gets sent back to the customer via email, the customer sees in their email client as the sender:

"Chris <support@example.com>"

Whereas it would be interesting to have the ability to customize it to something like:

"Support Example <support@example.com>"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4580].
{panel}
Hi,

We've started using the JIRA Service Desk since October. We like to give our customers an optimal experience. 

One of the things we would like to see change, is the possibility to change the columns the customer sees in the Portal when look at his requests. We don't need the "service desk" column for example, but would love to add a "date entered". 

Thanks for reviewing!

Kind regards,

Robin


**

*UPDATE by [~6cf75f652d57]*

*We have released the following:* 
 # Jira Admins can remove any existing column in the request list page (customer portal) 
 # Jira Admins can add the following columns
 ## created date
 ## Updated date
 ## Due date
 ## Assignee
 ## Priority
 # Your *customers can now sort* on most of these columns. 

*How to do this:* 

If you are a Jira Admin, you can go to 'https://<your instance>/servicedesk/customer/user/requests?page=1', and click on the 'Customize' sidebar, you should be able to customize the columns that your customers see in this page. 

[Support Documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/untitled-entry-2021-03-05-at-09-29-32/]

h3. Problem Definition

Service Desk customers do not know when an issue has been assigned

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Why this is important

h3. Workaround 

Can use a combination of automation rules and workflow changes to send an e-mail whenever issue enters an assigned status.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4573].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when the MIME message in the mail headers do not obey the [RFC2183|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2183.txt] convention, the only error message that can be seen in the Email Requests is {{There was an error reading the body of email message}}. The only way to find out the information on why the emails are being rejected is to check the log on Atlassian Support end.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if the email request can provide more detailed explanation why the emails are being rejected (e.g: there is a problem with the email header) so that it will be visible to the users

h3. Why this is important
The customer will have the awareness that JIRA Service Desk can only accept email with headers that obey the specific criteria.
fields.summary: Provide detail information on the error message why the email is being rejected
